Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired brown and red in places); trace of rosette in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat grazing to left (haunches, tail and part of hind legs remaining); pendant and rising triangles and swastika as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The goat on this chalice isa rarity, as goats are rarely depicted on Mature Animal Style vases.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 265, no. 571, pl. 72)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0621) (phase 2)
